laboratory_examinations.findings: Normal levels initially, but subsequently elevated during infancy and childhood (mean 12.0 ± 1.34 mg/dL); upper end of normal for adults (mean 10.3 ± 0.67 mg/dL).
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Elevated during infancy/childhood, improved to upper end of normal by adulthood.

laboratory_examinations.findings: At the lower end of the normal range during childhood and adulthood.
Average for children with H223R mutation was 0.90 ± 0.45 mg/mg; elevated even in adulthood (mean 0.51 ± 0.09 mg/mg).
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Persistently elevated despite normalizing serum calcium.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Suppressed PTH (<4 pg/mL) in adults with the H223R mutation; not significantly different between children and adults.
Above normal range except for a few cases.
Within or slightly above the reference range.
0.39 mg/dL in one adult, with calculated GFR of 108.9 mL/min/1.73 m².
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Progressive decline noted; latest serum creatinine in H223R-16 was 4.04 mg/dL.
